title: C++ Level 10 â€” Combined STL & Logic Problems
concept: Combine loops, arrays, strings, sets and maps to solve slightly larger problems.

challenges.title: Fibonacci Index
challenges.description: Given an integer a, determine its index in the Fibonacci sequence (0-based: fib(0)=0, fib(1)=1). If a is not a Fibonacci number, print -1.
challenges.outputDescription: Index n such that fib(n)=a, or -1.

challenges.title: Second Maximum in Sequence
challenges.description: The sequence consists of distinct positive integers ending with 0. Find the second largest element (ignore the final 0).
challenges.inputDescription: Positive integers (distinct) each on its own line, ending with 0.

challenges.title: Sequence Statistics
challenges.description:
Given a sequence of integers ending with 0, compute:
1) the sum of all numbers (excluding final 0),
2) the maximum value,
3) the count of even numbers,
4) how many numbers are equal to the maximum.
Print each result on its own line in that order.
challenges.inputDescription: Integers each on its own line, ending with 0.
challenges.outputDescription: Four lines: sum, max, evenCount, maxCount.

challenges.title: 8 Queens Check
challenges.description: Eight queens are placed on a chessboard. Positions are given as 8 pairs (x,y). Check if any two queens attack each other. If no two attack, print NO, otherwise YES.
challenges.inputDescription: 8 lines of two integers x y (1..8).
examples: Example based on classic 8 queens check problem.

challenges.title: Bowling Pins
challenges.description: There are N bowling pins in a row, initially standing. Then K balls are thrown, each knocks down pins from l to r (inclusive). After all throws, print a string of length N: 'I' for standing pins, '.' for knocked down pins.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N K. Next K lines: l r.
challenges.outputDescription: One line: string of length N consisting of 'I' and '.'.

challenges.title: Guessing Game Helper
challenges.description: Augustus thinks of a number from 1 to n. Beatrice repeatedly gives subsets of numbers and Augustus answers YES if his number is in the subset, NO otherwise. When Beatrice writes HELP, print all numbers that could still be Augustus's number in increasing order.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Then alternating lines: a line with numbers (subset) or the word HELP, and lines with YES/NO answers for subsets.
challenges.outputDescription: One line: all possible numbers separated by spaces when HELP appears.
examples: Based on Snakify 'Guess the number' helper problem.

challenges.title: Languages in School
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. For each student: integer k, then k lines with language names.
challenges.outputDescription: Two blocks: count and languages common to all, then count and languages in the union.

challenges.title: Word Occurrence Counts in Text
challenges.description: Text is given in a single line. For each word, print how many times it has occurred before in the text. Words are separated by spaces. Print counts on the same line separated by spaces.
challenges.outputDescription: One line: integers for each word's previous count.
examples:
Input:
one two one two two

Output:
0 0 1 1 2

challenges.title: Most Frequent Word Multi-Line
challenges.description: Given n lines of text, determine the word with the highest frequency. If there are several, print the lexicographically smallest. Same as earlier but now input can be large scenario.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Next n lines: text.
examples: Example: hi hi what is hi -> hi

challenges.title: Latin-English Dictionary Inversion (Simplified)
challenges.description: You are given an English-Latin dictionary. Each line has the format: english - latin1,latin2,... Build the corresponding Latin-English dictionary: for each Latin word, list all English words that translate to it. Print lines sorted by Latin word; for each line print: latin - english1,english2,... with English words sorted.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Next N lines: 'english - latin1,latin2,...'.
challenges.outputDescription: Latin-English dictionary in the described format.
examples: Example based on standard Latin-English inversion problem.
